More troubling, the French and Germans were, intentionally or not, giving Saddam Hussein 's regime the impression that they could stop a military confrontation, Donald Rumsfeld writes. , Mitch Daniels recently was chosen as the second-most-likely to get the GOP nomination, after Mitt Romney . Mike Pence didn't make the top 10. So why are Mike Pence 's backers so enthusiastic about him? Mike Pence displays the kind of optimism, moral values and gutsy leadership we need in a president-- and a presidential nominee, says the draft-Pence website, theconservativechampion.org. "He bridges the gap between the establishment and the grassroots," wrote influential conservative blogger Erick Erickson on RedState.com. Mike Pence gets credit for standing up to his

creation of an Iraqi transitional government. He instead appointed a "governing council" of Iraqis but refused to give even them any responsibility. The result: delays in elections and in building post-Saddam institutions. You are always better having a president look at each option, at the pros and cons, and make a decision among them, than trying to merge them, says Mr. Donald Rumsfeld , especially when positions are "contradictory to a certain extent."
